Package com.rb.biz.guice

Class RBSimpleTestClock

java.lang.Object
com.rb.biz.guice.RBSimpleTestClock
All Implemented Interfaces:
RBClock
public class RBSimpleTestClock
extends java.lang.Object
implements RBClock
A simple RBClock that just stores a LocalDateTime and doesn't do any tricks with pre-generating thread-local clocks like RBThreadLocalClock does. We should always use this unless there's a specific need (e.g. when running parallel backtests) to use RBThreadLocalClock.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • RBSimpleTestClock

      public RBSimpleTestClock()
      Unlike most data classes, RBClock gets injected (Guice), so we have to have a public no-arg constructor. Other code is discouraged from using this. At any rate, you usually need to specify a starting time, so this is not very useful. This is marked VisibleForTesting just so we can flag any prod usages, but in reality we don't even want any direct usages in tests. It's just here for Guice.
